hints.label: thm-einstein-from-fractal-set
hints.title: Einstein Equations from Fractal Set (Sketch)
hints.content:
575: :label: thm-einstein-from-fractal-set
576: 
577: In the continuum limit $N \to \infty$ and low-curvature regime, the Fractal Set dynamics imply:
578: 
579: $$
580: G_{\mu\nu} + \Lambda g_{\mu\nu} = 8\pi G \, T_{\mu\nu}^{\text{eff}}
581: $$
582: 
583: where:
584: - $G_{\mu\nu} = R_{\mu\nu} - \frac{1}{2} R g_{\mu\nu}$ is the Einstein tensor
585: - $\Lambda$ is an emergent cosmological constant
586: - $T_{\mu\nu}^{\text{eff}}$ is an effective stress-energy tensor from episode statistics
587: 
588: **Proof outline**:
589: 1. The QSD density $\rho \propto \sqrt{\det g} e^{-U_{\text{eff}}/T}$ defines a variational principle
590: 2. Demanding consistency with causal set action $S_{\text{CST}}$ yields field equations
591: 3. In the continuum limit, these reduce to Einstein equations with effective matter content
hints.raw_directive:
572: ### 6.2. Emergence of General Relativity
573: 
574: :::{prf:theorem} Einstein Equations from Fractal Set (Sketch)
575: :label: thm-einstein-from-fractal-set
576: 
577: In the continuum limit $N \to \infty$ and low-curvature regime, the Fractal Set dynamics imply:
578: 
579: $$
580: G_{\mu\nu} + \Lambda g_{\mu\nu} = 8\pi G \, T_{\mu\nu}^{\text{eff}}
581: $$
582: 
583: where:
584: - $G_{\mu\nu} = R_{\mu\nu} - \frac{1}{2} R g_{\mu\nu}$ is the Einstein tensor
585: - $\Lambda$ is an emergent cosmological constant
586: - $T_{\mu\nu}^{\text{eff}}$ is an effective stress-energy tensor from episode statistics
587: 
588: **Proof outline**:
589: 1. The QSD density $\rho \propto \sqrt{\det g} e^{-U_{\text{eff}}/T}$ defines a variational principle
590: 2. Demanding consistency with causal set action $S_{\text{CST}}$ yields field equations
591: 3. In the continuum limit, these reduce to Einstein equations with effective matter content
592:

hints.label: prop-testable-predictions
hints.title: Testable Predictions from Fractal Set Causal Structure
hints.content:
599: :label: prop-testable-predictions
600: 
601: The Fractal Set causal structure leads to observable consequences:
602: 
603: 1. **Discreteness scale**: The average proper distance between episodes is:
604: 
605: $$
606: \ell_{\text{Planck}}^{\text{eff}} = \left(\frac{V_{\text{total}}}{N}\right)^{1/d}
607: $$
608: 
609: For $N \sim 10^{60}$ episodes (Planck-scale discretization), $\ell_{\text{Planck}}^{\text{eff}} \sim 10^{-35}$ m.
610: 
611: 2. **Modified dispersion relations**: High-energy particles experience corrections:
612: 
613: $$
614: E^2 = p^2 c^2 + m^2 c^4 + \alpha \frac{E^3}{\ell_{\text{Planck}}^{\text{eff}}} + \ldots
615: $$
616: 
617: where $\alpha$ is a dimensionless constant.
618: 
619: 3. **Lorentz invariance violations**: At energies $E \sim \ell_{\text{Planck}}^{-1}$, expect deviations from special relativity observable in:
620:    - Cosmic ray spectra
hints.raw_directive:
596: ### 6.3. Observable Predictions
597: 
598: :::{prf:proposition} Testable Predictions from Fractal Set Causal Structure
599: :label: prop-testable-predictions
600: 
601: The Fractal Set causal structure leads to observable consequences:
602: 
603: 1. **Discreteness scale**: The average proper distance between episodes is:
604: 
605: $$
606: \ell_{\text{Planck}}^{\text{eff}} = \left(\frac{V_{\text{total}}}{N}\right)^{1/d}
607: $$
608: 
609: For $N \sim 10^{60}$ episodes (Planck-scale discretization), $\ell_{\text{Planck}}^{\text{eff}} \sim 10^{-35}$ m.
610: 
611: 2. **Modified dispersion relations**: High-energy particles experience corrections:
612: 
613: $$
614: E^2 = p^2 c^2 + m^2 c^4 + \alpha \frac{E^3}{\ell_{\text{Planck}}^{\text{eff}}} + \ldots
615: $$
616: 
617: where $\alpha$ is a dimensionless constant.
618: 
619: 3. **Lorentz invariance violations**: At energies $E \sim \ell_{\text{Planck}}^{-1}$, expect deviations from special relativity observable in:
620:    - Cosmic ray spectra
621:    - Gamma-ray burst photons
